intro: Mentha pulegium var. erecta, commonly known as water mint, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite leaves that are often grayish-green in color. The plant produces small, pale blue or violet flowers arranged in whorls along the upper stems. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as stream banks and wet meadows. Its aromatic leaves and flowers contain essential oils, which contribute to its medicinal and culinary uses.
